thread.title: Danny Rose's brother in danger of lengthy ban after slapping red card out of referee's hand | Metro News
thread.title_full: Danny Rose's brother in danger of lengthy ban after slapping red card out of referee's hand | Metro News

author: Coral Barry For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Danny Rose's brother in danger of lengthy ban after slapping red card out of referee's hand | Metro News
text:
Search Metro Follow us Danny Rose’s brother in danger of misconduct charge after slapping red card out of referee’s hand Coral Barry for Metro.co.uk Sunday 19 Feb 2017 6:02 pm Mitchell Rose plays for Newport County (Picture: Getty) 
Danny Rose’s brother was so furious at being sent off for Newport County that he slapped the red card out of the referee’s hand. Theo Walcott left red-faced as Arsenal fans slam club for 'disrespectful' gesture 
The Tottenham star’s brother, Mitchell Rose is a midfielder at the Welsh club, but was guilty of giving away a last minute penalty with the game level at 2-2. 
Newport blew a 2-0 lead against Cambridge United and referee Mark Heywood was in doubt when he pointed to the spot after Rose’s foul in the box in the 90th minute. 
Rose furiously protested his innocence but he could not convince Heywood to keep his cards in his pocket. Danny Rose’s brother (Mitchell) here getting himself sent off playing for Newport County #TemperTemper pic.twitter.com/9Bqko2sNEU 
— Carl Campbell (@carlcampbell808) February 18, 2017 
Heywood brandished the red at an angry Rose who slapped the referee’s hand sending the card to the ground. 
Cambridge scored the penalty to win the game 3-2 to complete remarkable comeback. 90' PENALTY TO CAMBRIDGE – MITCH ROSE HAS BEEN SENT OFF
